lead_paragraph: The three men were given four-year prison terms with three years suspended, meaning they will serve one year, for the brazen attack on two lawmakers.

byline.contributor: Julia Wallace contributed reporting from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

headline.print_headline: Cambodian Leader’s Bodyguards Convicted of Assault
headline.main: Cambodian Leader’s Bodyguards Convicted of Assaulting Opposition Figures

snippet: The three men were given four-year prison terms with three years suspended, meaning they will serve one year, for the brazen attack on two lawmakers.
abstract: Three bodyguards for Cambodian Prime Min Hun Sen are convicted of assaulting opposition lawmakers Kung Sophea and Nhay Chamraoen in October; attack, which severely injured both lawmakers, was condemned internationally; critics call sentence of four years in prison with three years suspended inadequate.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
